SEARCH
Package pt.uc.dei.services

Class AppraisalService

java.lang.Object
pt.uc.dei.services.AppraisalService
All Implemented Interfaces:
Serializable
public class AppraisalService extends Object implements Serializable
Service class for managing appraisal-related operations.

Provides functionality for appraisal creation, retrieval, updating, and filtering. Handles business logic and validation rules.

See Also:

    • createAppraisal

      public AppraisalDTO createAppraisal(CreateAppraisalDTO createAppraisalDTO)
      Creates a new appraisal.
      Parameters:
      createAppraisalDTO - The DTO containing appraisal creation data
      Returns:
      The created appraisal DTO
      Throws:
      IllegalArgumentException - If validation fails
      IllegalStateException - If business rules are violated

    • updateAppraisal

      public AppraisalDTO updateAppraisal(UpdateAppraisalDTO updateAppraisalDTO, boolean isAdmin)
      Updates an existing appraisal with the provided data.
      Parameters:
      updateAppraisalDTO - The DTO containing updated appraisal data
      isAdmin - Whether the update is performed by an admin
      Returns:
      The updated AppraisalDTO
      Throws:
      IllegalArgumentException - If appraisal not found
      IllegalStateException - If appraisal cannot be modified

    • getAppraisalsWithFilters

      public Map<String,Object> getAppraisalsWithFilters(Long appraisedUserId, String appraisedUserName, String appraisedUserEmail, Long appraisingUserId, String appraisingUserName, String appraisingUserEmail, Long cycleId, AppraisalState state, AppraisalParameter parameter, OrderBy orderBy, Integer limit, Integer offset)
      Retrieves appraisals with advanced filtering options.
      Parameters:
      appraisedUserId - Optional filter by appraised user ID
      appraisedUserName - Optional filter by appraised user name
      appraisedUserEmail - Optional filter by appraised user email
      appraisingUserId - Optional filter by appraising user ID
      appraisingUserName - Optional filter by appraising user name
      appraisingUserEmail - Optional filter by appraising user email
      cycleId - Optional filter by cycle ID
      state - Optional filter by appraisal state
      parameter - Optional filter by appraisal parameter
      orderBy - Optional ordering
      limit - Maximum number of results
      offset - Starting position for pagination
      Returns:
      Map containing filtered appraisal DTOs and metadata

    • getPDFOfAppraisals

      public jakarta.ws.rs.core.StreamingOutput getPDFOfAppraisals(Long appraisedUserId, String appraisedUserName, String appraisedUserEmail, Long appraisingUserId, String appraisingUserName, String appraisingUserEmail, Long cycleId, AppraisalState state, AppraisalParameter parameter, OrderBy orderBy, Language language)
      Generates a PDF of appraisals with the given filters.
      Parameters:
      appraisedUserId - Optional filter by appraised user ID
      appraisedUserName - Optional filter by appraised user name
      appraisedUserEmail - Optional filter by appraised user email
      appraisingUserId - Optional filter by appraising user ID
      appraisingUserName - Optional filter by appraising user name
      appraisingUserEmail - Optional filter by appraising user email
      cycleId - Optional filter by cycle ID
      state - Optional filter by appraisal state
      parameter - Optional filter by appraisal parameter
      orderBy - Optional ordering
      language - Language for the PDF
      Returns:
      StreamingOutput for the generated PDF

    • isManagerOfUser

      public boolean isManagerOfUser(UserEntity manager, UserEntity user)
      Checks if a user is a manager of another user. This is a simplified implementation - adjust based on your business logic.
      Parameters:
      manager - The potential manager
      user - The user to check
      Returns:
      True if manager is authorized to appraise the user

    • closeAppraisalsByIds

      public int closeAppraisalsByIds(List<Long> appraisalIds)
      Closes specific appraisals by their IDs. Only COMPLETED appraisals in OPEN cycles can be closed.
      Parameters:
      appraisalIds - List of appraisal IDs to close
      Returns:
      Number of successfully closed appraisals
      Throws:
      IllegalArgumentException - If no valid appraisals found

    • closeCompletedAppraisalsByCycleId

      public int closeCompletedAppraisalsByCycleId(Long cycleId)
      Closes all COMPLETED appraisals in a specific cycle. Only works if the cycle is OPEN.
      Parameters:
      cycleId - The cycle ID
      Returns:
      Number of successfully closed appraisals
      Throws:
      IllegalArgumentException - If cycle not found or not OPEN

    • closeCompletedAppraisalsByUserId

      public int closeCompletedAppraisalsByUserId(Long userId)
      Closes all COMPLETED appraisals for a specific user. Only works for appraisals in OPEN cycles.
      Parameters:
      userId - The user ID (appraised user)
      Returns:
      Number of successfully closed appraisals
      Throws:
      IllegalArgumentException - If user not found

    • closeAllCompletedAppraisals

      public int closeAllCompletedAppraisals()
      Closes all COMPLETED appraisals in all OPEN cycles. Administrative operation.
      Returns:
      Number of successfully closed appraisals

    • checkIfManagerOfUser

      public boolean checkIfManagerOfUser(Long appraisalId, Long managerId)
      Checks if the given manager is the appraising user for the specified appraisal.
      Parameters:
      appraisalId - The appraisal ID
      managerId - The manager's user ID
      Returns:
      True if the manager is the appraising user, false otherwise

    • countAllAppraisals

      public long countAllAppraisals()
      Counts all appraisals in the system.
      Returns:
      Total number of appraisals

    • countAppraisalsByState

      public long countAppraisalsByState(AppraisalState state)
      Counts all appraisals by a specific state.
      Parameters:
      state - The appraisal state to filter by
      Returns:
      Total number of appraisals in the given state
